title: minerjones
author: minerjones
created_time: April 02, 2023, 04:06:32 PMLast edit: April 02, 2023, 04:33:33 PM by minerjones
content: Some fun crypto collectibles up for grabs:LOT 1: Alpen Coin DIY x19*Comes with holograms, instruction card, postcards, and stickers*STARTING BID: 0.0075BTCLOT 2: Crypto Candle *Website/company is no longer active*STARTING BID: 0.0008BTCLOT 3: Bitpay silver 1oz coins, ICG graded x2STARTING BID: 0.0018BTCLOT 4: Bitcoin Bull resin figure/statue*Right horn and tip of tail were repaired due to damage in original shipping*STARTING BID: 0.0005BTCSTARTING BID PER LOT: SEE ABOVEBTCMINIMUM BID INCREMENT PER LOT: 0.0001BTC**Please limit bids to ONLY 4 decimal places**END TIME: APRIL 7st, 2023, 14:00:00 PDT**Payment due within 24 hours of auction end!!**SNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes PER LOT will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time PER LOT.If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid PER LOT.PAYMENT: Bitcoin BTC. A signed PGP message will be sent to winner with payment addressSHIPPING: Based on location and preferenceOWNER: Decline to be listed

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Lot 2 @ .0009BTCI remember looking in to the crypto candle when I first saw their cheesy ass ad years back (believe I’ve even got that advertisement video saved somewhere).  I read their Terms of Service and it was a complete scam. I wonder if they actually ever paid out any bitcoin to winners, or if there’s any information out there that talks about it being a skam. Regardless, interesting part of Bitcoin history.

comments.author: Cyrus

comments.body: Quote from: ChiBitCTy on April 06, 2023, 04:51:34 PMLot 2 @ .0009BTCI remember looking in to the crypto candle when I first saw their cheesy ass ad years back (believe I’ve even got that advertisement video saved somewhere).  I read their Terms of Service and it was a complete scam. I wonder if they actually ever paid out any bitcoin to winners, or if there’s any information out there that talks about it being a skam. Regardless, interesting part of Bitcoin history. Also, it probably doesn't smell all that good either. Stop bidding!  Jokes aside I'm bidding for the novelty, saw it auctioned before and the concept seems interesting.0.0013BTC

I wonder if they actually ever paid out any bitcoin to winners, or if there’s any information out there that talks about it being a skam. Regardless, interesting part of Bitcoin history. Also, it probably doesn't smell all that good either. Stop bidding!  Jokes aside I'm bidding for the novelty, saw it auctioned before and the concept seems interesting.0.0013BTCLol, you should have seen the TOS for this thing seriously ..and the commercial for that matter (will try to dig it up).  Btw you accidentally bid the same amount as the previous bidder of the candle. Hopefully for the both of us another one pops up before long so we can try our luck again (I forgot the auction closed today, otherwise would have bid again).  Until then ..
